DOC.brief_summary: This one-year pilot study 30 non-treatment seek young adult e-cigarette/cigarette dual user ( 15 males/15 female ) use smartphone-based ecological momentary assessment ( EMA ) gather real-time data e-cigarette cigarette behavior 1-week cigarette/e-cigarette dual use period 2-week exclusive e-cigarette use period . Exclusive e- cigarette use promote contingency management ( CM ) procedure . ( 1 ) Participants respond daily random prompt assess in-the-moment use e-cigarettes/cigarettes subjective factor ( rating satisfaction withdrawal ) contextual factor ( location , activity , social cue ) associate episode use . Participants also complete daily electronic diary document e-cigarette use episodes/day , satisfaction e-cigarette experience study .
DOC.brief_title: Electronic Cigarette Use Young Adult Men Women
DOC.criteria: 1. 18 24 year age ; 2. smoke least 5 cigarettes/day ; 3. breath COâ‰¥10 ppm ; 4. experience ecigarette use , define use ecigarette least four time past month prefer ecigarette ( minimize cigarette use period cigarette abstinence due difficulty use ecigarettes . ) ; 5. fluent English ; 6. functioning cell phone personal use wireless , camera , application ( via Apple Android platform ) capability ; 7. access wireless network least daily ; 8. selfreported good health . Exclusion Criteria . 1. report serious medical illness ; 2. enrol substance abuse smoke cessation program/research study ; 3. interested use smoke cessation pharmacotherapy study ( isolate effect ecigarette pharmacotherapy ) ; 4. take psychoactive medication ; 5. woman currently/planning pregnant breastfeeding .
